item.title: Functional Options
item.description: The functional options pattern is a mechanism for providing flexible configuration to a Go library and in this article I will be exploring how it is implemented in uptrace-go. There are other less flexible techniques for achieving the same goal like config structs and positional arguments which I won’t cover but are good to know. As you can tell from the title, functions are central to the implementation of this pattern and in uptrace-go it all starts with the option function type.
